metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14737 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A cryptographic cache-based side channel in the RSA implementation in Botanbefore 1.10.17, and 1.11.x and 2.x before 2.3.0, allows a local attacker torecover information about RSA secret keys, as demonstrated by CacheD. Thisoccurs because an array is indexed with bits derived from a secret key.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbotan-1.10-1 - 1.10.17-0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: botan1.10 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.17-0.1').
